Material used.Material Name: HEK293 cells transfected with ACTA1 mutants
Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using HEK293 cells transiently transfected with wild-type or mutant ACTA1 constructs.

Readout description.Result Description: Protein expression levels were reduced by 30% compared to wild-type.
Protein expression levels were increased by 20% compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each variant.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type ACTA1 construct was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression levels greater than 100% of wild-type controls.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression levels less than 80% or greater than 120% of wild-type controls.

Material used.Material Name: Primary myoblasts from patients with dominant centronuclear myopathy
Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using primary myoblasts derived from patients carrying ACTA1 mutations.

Readout description.Result Description: Cells showed reduced α-actinin staining compared to wild-type cells.
Cells showed increased α-actinin aggregation in the cytoplasm.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each variant.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type α-actinin antibody was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Cells without primary antibodies were used as a negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Staining intensity comparable to wild-type cells.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Reduced or altered staining patterns compared to wild-type cells.
